title: AD-AS graph - recessionary gap - LR adjustment

content.prompt: The economy of a country is currently in equilibrium at point A in the diagram above. If the government does nothing and wages are flexible, which of the following will most likely occur in the long run?

choices.label: Falling wages will shift the aggregate demand curve to the right, producing full employment.
Rising wages will shift the aggregate demand curve to the right, producing full employment.
The economy will remain at point A.
Rising wages will shift the aggregate supply curve to the right, producing full employment.
Falling wages will shift the aggregate supply curve to the right, producing full employment.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
